curriculumStandard: New York State K-12 Social Studies Framework - Grade 7: History of the United States and New York
curriculumFocus: US History from colonial times through Reconstruction, with emphasis on New York State history

topics.name: Pre-Colonial Native Americans
topics.description: History of Indigenous societies prior to European colonization with focus on people, events, and places in New York State
subtopics: Native American life in New York region

media.title: 500 Nations
media.relevance: Kevin Costner narrated 8-part documentary covering Native American history; Episode 1 covers Northeast woodland peoples
media.notes: Show relevant episodes on Iroquois and Northeast peoples; comprehensive and respectful

media.title: We Shall Remain: Episode 1 - After the Mayflower
media.relevance: PBS American Experience documentary on Wampanoag people and first contact
media.notes: Tells story from Native American perspective; excellent primary sources

media.title: Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee
media.relevance: HBO film depicting Native American history from their perspective
media.notes: TV-14; may be appropriate for mature 7th graders; discusses difficult history

media.title: The Iroquois
media.relevance: Schlessinger Media educational video on Iroquois Confederacy
media.notes: Designed for classroom use; covers government structure and daily life

media.title: Kahentiiosta: Sky Woman
media.relevance: Documentary about Mohawk culture and the Sky Woman creation story
media.notes: Authentic representation of Haudenosaunee culture

topics.name: Colonial Settlement
topics.description: European colonization of North America including Dutch, English, and French settlements
subtopics: Dutch New Amsterdam - Henry Hudson, Peter Stuyvesant
French settlements in Canada and Great Lakes
Trade and commerce in colonial era

media.title: New Amsterdam
media.relevance: PBS documentary on Dutch colonial New York
media.notes: Specifically covers New York colonial history; excellent for NY State curriculum

media.title: National Treasure
media.relevance: Adventure film set partly in historical New York and Philadelphia with founding documents
media.notes: Fictional but sparks interest in colonial history and founding documents

media.title: Last of the Mohicans
media.relevance: Set during French and Indian War in colonial New York
media.notes: R-rated for violence; teacher reference; select scenes may work; set in NY wilderness

media.title: Gangs of New York
media.relevance: Depicts 1860s New York City - NOT for classroom but useful teacher reference
media.notes: R-rated; NOT appropriate for classroom; shows NYC immigrant history

media.title: Colonial House
media.relevance: PBS reality series where modern families live as 1628 colonists
media.notes: Excellent for understanding daily colonial life challenges

topics.name: Medieval Europe
topics.description: Study of European feudalism, kingdoms, and medieval society
subtopics: Magna Carta and origins of rights

media.title: Castle
media.relevance: David Macaulay animated documentary showing castle construction and medieval life
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - excellent educational animation; based on the book

media.title: Cathedral
media.relevance: David Macaulay animated documentary on medieval cathedral construction
media.notes: Companion to Castle; shows medieval church and architecture

media.title: A Knight's Tale
media.relevance: Depicts medieval tournaments, social hierarchy, and knight culture
media.notes: PG-13 but mostly clean; anachronistic music but shows medieval society well

media.title: Robin Hood (2010)
media.relevance: Depicts medieval England, Magna Carta origins, and feudal conflicts
media.notes: PG-13 for battle scenes; select clips on Magna Carta may be useful

media.title: The Name of the Rose
media.relevance: Set in medieval monastery; shows medieval church and scholarship
media.notes: R-rated; teacher reference only; excellent depiction of monastic life

media.title: Horrible Histories: Measly Middle Ages
media.relevance: British educational comedy series covering medieval history with humor
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - engaging and humorous; perfect for middle school

media.title: Terry Jones' Medieval Lives
media.relevance: BBC documentary series examining life of various medieval people
media.notes: 8 episodes covering peasant, monk, knight, etc.; hosted by Monty Python member

media.title: The Black Death: The World's Most Devastating Plague
media.relevance: Great Courses documentary on the Black Death and its effects
media.notes: Academic but accessible; covers pandemic's impact on medieval society

media.title: Crash Course World History: The Dark Ages
media.relevance: Medieval Europe overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] John Green; engaging and educational

media.title: TED-Ed: A Day in the Life of a Medieval Lord
media.relevance: Medieval daily life
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Animated medieval life

media.title: TED-Ed: The Black Death
media.relevance: Plague and its impact
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Historical context of pandemic

media.title: Crash Course World History: The Renaissance
media.relevance: Renaissance overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Art, science, and humanism

media.title: Oversimplified: Henry VIII
media.relevance: English Reformation context
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Reformation and Tudor England

media.title: TED-Ed: Leonardo da Vinci's Genius
media.relevance: Renaissance polymath
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Da Vinci's inventions and art

media.title: Simple History: Life of a Medieval Knight
media.relevance: Knights and chivalry
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Animated medieval life

topics.name: The Renaissance in Europe
topics.description: European Renaissance as a time of social, scientific, artistic, and religious rebirth from 1463 to 1650
subtopics: Renaissance art - da Vinci, Michelangelo, Raphael
Printing press and spread of ideas
Humanism and new ways of thinking

media.title: Ever After: A Cinderella Story
media.relevance: Set during Renaissance France; features Leonardo da Vinci as a character
media.notes: PG-13 but appropriate; excellent Renaissance costumes and setting

media.title: Leonardo da Vinci: The Genius
media.relevance: Documentary exploring da Vinci's life, art, and inventions
media.notes: Great introduction to Renaissance polymath

media.title: The Agony and the Ecstasy
media.relevance: Classic film about Michelangelo painting the Sistine Chapel
media.notes: Charlton Heston as Michelangelo; shows Renaissance art and patronage

media.title: Medici: Masters of Florence
media.relevance: TV series about the powerful Medici family in Renaissance Florence
media.notes: TV-MA; NOT for classroom; excellent teacher reference on Renaissance Florence

media.title: The Story of the Renaissance
media.relevance: Educational documentary covering Renaissance art, science, and culture
media.notes: Designed for educational use

media.title: Galileo
media.relevance: Biographical film about Galileo and conflict with the Church
media.notes: Depicts scientific revolution and church-science conflicts

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Roaring 20s
media.relevance: 1920s culture including Harlem
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Includes Harlem Renaissance context

media.title: The Harlem Renaissance Explained
media.relevance: Harlem Renaissance overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] NYC cultural movement

media.title: TED-Ed: Langston Hughes and the Harlem Renaissance
media.relevance: Hughes and poetry movement
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Key Harlem figure

media.title: Duke Ellington and the Cotton Club
media.relevance: Jazz history in Harlem
media.notes: [Quick Clip] NYC jazz history

topics.name: The Protestant Reformation
topics.description: Religious reformation and its impact on European society and later American colonization

media.title: Luther
media.relevance: Biographical film about Martin Luther and the Protestant Reformation
media.notes: PG-13; may be appropriate for mature 7th graders; comprehensive look at Luther

media.title: Martin Luther: The Idea that Changed the World
media.relevance: Documentary narrated by Hugh Bonneville on Luther and the Reformation
media.notes: Made for 500th anniversary of Reformation; accessible and educational

media.title: A Man for All Seasons
media.relevance: Academy Award winner about Thomas More and Henry VIII's break with Rome
media.notes: G-rated; excellent for discussing English Reformation and conscience

media.title: Elizabeth
media.relevance: Depicts Elizabeth I and Protestant England
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; teacher reference on English Reformation

media.title: The Reformation
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the Protestant Reformation
media.notes: Straightforward educational documentary

topics.name: The Aztecs
topics.description: Study of Aztec civilization, governmental structure, religious ceremonies, and temples
subtopics: Tenochtitlan - capital city on a lake

media.title: Engineering an Empire: The Aztecs
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Aztec engineering and Tenochtitlan
media.notes: Focus on engineering achievements; Peter Weller narrates

media.title: The Road to El Dorado
media.relevance: Animated adventure featuring Mesoamerican-inspired civilization
media.notes: Fictional but excellent visual introduction to Mesoamerican aesthetics

media.title: Conquest of the Aztec Empire
media.relevance: Documentary covering Cortés and the fall of Tenochtitlan
media.notes: Covers both Aztec civilization and Spanish conquest

topics.name: The Incas
topics.description: Study of Incan civilization in South America, their empire, and achievements

media.title: The Emperor's New Groove
media.relevance: Animated comedy set in Incan-inspired empire
media.notes: Not historically accurate but fun visual introduction to Incan aesthetics

media.title: Engineering an Empire: The Inca
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Incan engineering achievements
media.notes: Covers Machu Picchu, road system, and architectural achievements

media.title: Machu Picchu: Secrets of the Incan Empire
media.relevance: National Geographic documentary exploring Machu Picchu
media.notes: Beautiful visuals of the famous citadel

topics.name: The United States Constitution
topics.description: Development of the Constitution, Constitutional Convention, and the framework of American government

media.title: Liberty's Kids: The Complete Series
media.relevance: Final episodes cover Constitutional Convention and ratification
media.notes: Animated series perfect for this age; episodes 38-40 cover Constitution

media.title: A More Perfect Union: America Becomes a Nation
media.relevance: Dramatization of the Constitutional Convention of 1787
media.notes: Made specifically for educational use; shows convention debates

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: The Preamble
media.relevance: Classic animated song teaching the Constitution's preamble
media.notes: Students can memorize preamble through the catchy song

media.title: The Federalist Papers: A Documentary
media.relevance: Documentary on Hamilton, Madison, and Jay's writings
media.notes: More advanced; good for enrichment

topics.name: The Erie Canal
topics.description: Construction and impact of the Erie Canal on New York State and national development

media.title: The Erie Canal
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on the Erie Canal construction and impact
media.notes: Comprehensive coverage of canal history

media.title: America: The Story of Us - Episode 3: Westward
media.relevance: Includes segment on Erie Canal and its role in westward expansion
media.notes: Modern production with reenactments

media.title: The Erie Canal: A Journey Through History
media.relevance: Educational video specifically about the canal for students
media.notes: Made for classroom use

media.title: The History of New York City
media.relevance: NYC from Dutch to modern
media.notes: [Quick Clip] NYC history overview

media.title: How Did New York Get Its Name?
media.relevance: Dutch to English transition
media.notes: [Quick Clip] New Amsterdam to New York

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Natives and the English
media.relevance: Early contact period
media.notes: [Quick Clip] First contact and early colonization

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Quakers, Dutch, and Ladies
media.relevance: Middle colonies
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Covers Dutch NY and Pennsylvania

media.title: The Iroquois Confederacy and American Democracy
media.relevance: Native influence on Constitution
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Important NY history

topics.name: Territorial Expansion
topics.description: American expansion including events like the Alamo and westward movement

media.title: Davy Crockett: King of the Wild Frontier
media.relevance: Disney classic featuring Davy Crockett and the Alamo
media.notes: Classic Disney; romanticized but engaging introduction to Alamo

media.title: The Alamo (2004)
media.relevance: Modern retelling of the Battle of the Alamo
media.notes: PG-13 for battle violence; more historically accurate; select scenes may work

media.title: The West
media.relevance: Ken Burns documentary series on westward expansion
media.notes: Comprehensive 8-part series; select relevant episodes

media.title: Oregon Trail: The Road to Western Expansion
media.relevance: Documentary on pioneer migration to Oregon
media.notes: Covers challenges and experiences of pioneers

topics.name: Women's Rights
topics.description: Early women's rights movement including the Seneca Falls Convention

media.title: Not for Ourselves Alone: Elizabeth Cady Stanton & Susan B. Anthony
media.relevance: Ken Burns documentary on two suffrage pioneers who worked in NY State
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for NY curriculum; can show in segments

media.title: Iron Jawed Angels
media.relevance: HBO film about the suffrage movement (later period)
media.notes: Covers later suffrage movement; powerful depiction of struggle for vote

media.title: One Woman, One Vote
media.relevance: PBS documentary on women's suffrage movement
media.notes: Comprehensive look at entire suffrage movement

media.title: Suffragette
media.relevance: British suffrage movement; useful comparison
media.notes: PG-13; set in Britain but shows suffrage struggle

topics.name: Impact of Industrialization
topics.description: The Industrial Revolution and its effects on American society and economy

media.title: Newsies
media.relevance: Disney musical about newsboy strike of 1899 in New York City
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - perfect for NY curriculum; engaging musical about labor

media.title: Oliver Twist (2005)
media.relevance: Dickens adaptation showing poverty and child labor in industrial England
media.notes: Set in England but excellent for understanding industrial era conditions

media.title: The Men Who Built America
media.relevance: History Channel series on Vanderbilt, Rockefeller, Carnegie, Morgan
media.notes: 8-part series; covers industrialists who shaped America; some based in NY

media.title: An American Tail
media.relevance: Animated film about immigrant mouse family in 1885 New York City
media.notes: Covers immigration to NYC during industrial era; accessible introduction

media.title: Crash Course US History: Taxes & Smuggling
media.relevance: Revolutionary causes
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Taxation without representation

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Constitution
media.relevance: Constitutional Convention
media.notes: [Quick Clip] How Constitution was created

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Bill of Rights
media.relevance: First 10 amendments
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Rights and freedoms

media.title: Hip Hughes: The 3/5 Compromise
media.relevance: Constitutional compromise on slavery
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Difficult but important topic

media.title: TED-Ed: What Is the Electoral College?
media.relevance: Electoral system explained
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Presidential election process

media.title: Crash Course US History: Industrial Economy
media.relevance: Gilded Age industrialization
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Big business and tycoons

media.title: Crash Course US History: Westward Expansion
media.relevance: Western settlement
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Manifest Destiny and impact

media.title: Crash Course US History: Immigration
media.relevance: Ellis Island era immigration
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Great wave of immigration

media.title: Simple History: Triangle Shirtwaist Factory Fire
media.relevance: NYC labor history
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Important NY labor event

media.title: Crash Course US History: Progressive Era
media.relevance: Reform movements
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Muckrakers and reforms

media.title: The Erie Canal Song - History
media.relevance: Erie Canal significance for NY
media.notes: [Quick Clip] NY State history essential

topics.name: Causes of the Civil War
topics.description: Growing sectional tensions, slavery, and states' rights leading to the Civil War
subtopics: New York's role - abolitionists and draft riots

media.title: Harriet
media.relevance: Biographical film about Harriet Tubman and the Underground Railroad
media.notes: PG-13 but appropriate; excellent modern telling of Tubman's story

media.title: Glory
media.relevance: 54th Massachusetts Infantry - first Black regiment in Civil War
media.notes: R-rated for war violence; teacher reference; excellent for Black soldiers' story

media.title: Lincoln
media.relevance: Spielberg film about Lincoln and the 13th Amendment
media.notes: PG-13; excellent for mature 7th graders; shows political process

media.title: The Civil War (Ken Burns)
media.relevance: Definitive 9-part documentary on the Civil War
media.notes: Select appropriate episodes; Episode 4 covers New York draft riots

media.title: Crash Course US History: Slavery
media.relevance: Institution of slavery
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Comprehensive slavery overview

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Civil War Part 1
media.relevance: War causes and early battles
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Causes through 1862

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Civil War Part 2
media.relevance: War conclusion and legacy
media.notes: [Quick Clip] 1863 through war's end

media.title: Crash Course US History: Reconstruction
media.relevance: Post-war Reconstruction
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Reconstruction era and failures

media.title: Extra History: The Haitian Revolution
media.relevance: First successful slave revolution (4 parts)
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Extra Credits series; very engaging

topics.name: Reconstruction and Beyond
topics.description: Period following the Civil War including Reconstruction and its challenges

media.title: Reconstruction: America After the Civil War
media.relevance: Henry Louis Gates Jr. PBS documentary on Reconstruction era
media.notes: Excellent modern documentary; 4 hours can be shown in segments

media.title: Birth of a Nation (1915) - Clips for Analysis
media.relevance: Historically important but deeply racist film - for analyzing propaganda
media.notes: DO NOT SHOW - only mention for understanding how history was distorted

media.title: The 13th
media.relevance: Ava DuVernay documentary on 13th Amendment and mass incarceration
media.notes: TV-MA; may be appropriate for mature students with preview; connects past to present

topics.name: Harlem Renaissance
topics.description: Celebration of African-American culture through art, music, and literature in the 1920s and 1930s

media.title: The Great Debaters
media.relevance: 1930s Black college debate team; shows era's intellectual achievements
media.notes: PG-13; inspiring film about Black education and achievement in Jim Crow era

media.title: Jazz (Ken Burns)
media.relevance: Comprehensive documentary on jazz history including Harlem Renaissance
media.notes: Episodes 4-5 cover Jazz Age and Harlem; extensive but excellent

media.title: Harlem Renaissance: American Art from the 1920s and 1930s
media.relevance: Documentary focused on visual arts of Harlem Renaissance
media.notes: Covers artists like Aaron Douglas and Jacob Lawrence

media.title: Duke Ellington: Reminiscing in Tempo
media.relevance: Documentary on Duke Ellington's life and music
media.notes: Covers Ellington's career in Harlem's Cotton Club

topics.name: Progressive Era
topics.description: Reform movements in government, labor, and social issues in the early 20th century

media.title: Triangle Fire
media.relevance: PBS American Experience documentary on the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire in NYC
media.notes: ESSENTIAL for NY curriculum; covers NYC labor history

media.title: The Jungle (audiobook selections)
media.relevance: Upton Sinclair's muckraking novel about meatpacking industry
media.notes: Read selected passages; too graphic to read in full but important

media.title: TR: The Story of Theodore Roosevelt
media.relevance: PBS documentary on Theodore Roosevelt - progressive president from NY
media.notes: NY native; covers progressive reforms; 4-part series

media.title: The Gilded Age
media.relevance: HBO drama set in 1880s New York high society
media.notes: TV-14; NOT for full classroom use; shows era's NYC society

topics.name: Expansionism
topics.description: United States territorial expansion in North America and other parts of the world

media.title: Rough Riders
media.relevance: TV miniseries about Theodore Roosevelt and the Spanish-American War
media.notes: Tom Berenger as Roosevelt; covers formation of Rough Riders and Cuba campaign

media.title: Crucible of Empire: The Spanish-American War
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the Spanish-American War and American imperialism
media.notes: Comprehensive coverage of the war and its implications

media.title: A Man, A Plan, A Canal: Panama
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the construction of the Panama Canal
media.notes: Covers engineering challenges and Roosevelt's role
